item.title: Shannon add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If you once forfeit the confidence of your fellow citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem. It is true that you may fool all of the people some of the time; you can even fool some of the people all of the time; but you can't fool all of the people all of the time. -Speech at Clinton, Illinois, September 8, 1854." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Always do what you are afraid to do." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The earth laughs in flowers." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Spencer Johnson
item.description: "Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people." -- Spencer Johnson

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Through their deeds, the dead of battle have spoken more eloquently for themselves than any of the living ever could. But we can only honor them by rededicating ourselves to the cause for which they gave a last full measure of devotion. " -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Dave Weinbaum
item.description: "Being truthful when you know it will cost you , Is the true test of honesty." -- Dave Weinbaum

item.title: Shannon add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one." -- George Washington

item.title: Shannon add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Shannon add a quote by George Washington Carver
item.description: "How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these. " -- George Washington Carver

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have a higher and grander standard of principle than George Washington. He could not lie; I can, but I won't." -- Mark Twain
